Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the operation's emergency evacuation diagram did not include an escape route, a meeting location outside, or a shelter in place location inside the home.
Correction Narrative: On 8/8/2025, the operation's Administrator provided an updated emergency diagram for the non-contiguous property. On 8/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided an updated emergency diagram for the primary property.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, the rtc did not have the required no trespassing signs.
Correction Narrative: On 8/11/2025, the operation's Administrator advised the "No Trespassing Signs were ordered on 08/08/2025 via the HHSCCR website.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the child's records reviewed showed discrepancies in the medical appointment dates, with several forms listing dates that did not match the date signed by the medical provider.
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: Documentation from medical appointments will be obtained on the same day. If not available the same day, a letter will be requested from the doctors office to place in the client's file.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the child records reviewed did not containt documentation of a completed hearing checkup since the child's placement on 12/11/24. Additionally, the most recent vision checkup was completed in April 2025, making it two months overdue.
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: Moving forward, staff have been instructed to ensure the hearing test is done at the three-day medical appointment and make sure the doctor has checked the box as well as provided feedback.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the child records reviewed found the suicide screening was not administered for March of 2025 as required.
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: All monthly suicide screenings will be posted on the calendar and conducted on the same day of each month. Screenings will be filed ASAP.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the child records reviewed found the admission assessment and 72 hours service plan were completed 6 days after placement. Additionally, the following information was found missing from the admission assessment: -Immediate goals of placement -The child s understanding of the placement  -The parent s expectations for placement -The child s social history -A description of the child s home environment and family functioning  -The child s birth and neonatal history -The child s mental health and substance abuse history -The child s history of any other placements outside the child s home -The child s skills and special interests -The child s criminal history, if applicable
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: Admission Assessment and 72 hour treatment plan will be conducted no more than 72 hours after the residents admission by a case manager or case aid.

Deficiency Narrative: One of the child records reviewed found the initial service plan was not completed within 45 days of placement. Additionally, service plan was not dated and signed by child, parent, caregivers, and 2 PLSP as required.
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: Staff will ensure that the initial service plan is completed within 45 days of placement, as well as dated and signed by the child, caregivers, and PLSP as required.

Deficiency Narrative: Two child records reviewed did not include documentation of known or unknown allergies on the exterior of records or in a clearly visible location.
Correction Narrative: On 7/11/2025, the operation's Administrator provided corrections via email: Moving forward, known allergies will be added to the client information placed on the front of the client binder.

Deficiency Narrative: Schedule II psychotropic medications were observed stored in a locked cabinet inside the laundry room, which is located off the living room. This makes the medications accessible when the laundry room is in use, creating a potential safety risk.
Correction Narrative: The schedule II medication was observed behind a locked door and the second lock is in a locked file cabinet.

Deficiency Narrative: During the ANE investigation, it was determined that a caregiver got into a physical altercation with a child in care resulting in the child receiving injuries to his face and body.
Correction Narrative: 3 of 6 children were interviewed and denied any corporal punishment or physical discipline.

Deficiency Narrative: The allegation is related to a DFPS abuse/neglect investigation.
Correction Narrative: On 7/16/2025, the operation's Director provided the following corrections via email: In response to the situation, the staff member involved was promptly removed from the facility and subsequently terminated from his direct care position. This action was taken due to his failure to adhere to the established protocols mandated by the Evidence-Based Intervention (EBI) training that he completed upon his hiring. Furthermore, Boys to Men has scheduled a comprehensive retraining session for all staff members on EBI, which will take place on July 15, 2025. In hopes of reinforcing our commitment to maintaining the highest standards of care and ensuring that all staff are fully equipped to adhere to necessary protocols.

Deficiency Narrative: No serious incident report regarding the incident in question was provided during the investigation.
Correction Narrative: On 8/4/2025, the operation's Director provided the following corrections via email: As of June 3, 2025, all staff were retrained on the requirements for reporting and documenting serious incidents. Updated the Serious Incident Reporting Policy to clearly define what constitutes a serious incident and the required timeline for documentation. All serious incidents must be documented using the official Serious Incident Report Form within 4 hours of the occurrence and submitted to administration the same day. Incident report audits will be conducted weekly by the Administrator to ensure full compliance. Failure to report incidents as outlined will result in progressive disciplinary action, including written warnings and potential termination.

Deficiency Narrative: Child victim's preliminary service plan indicates he may not share a bedroom with another resident. Information obtained throughout the investigation indicates the child victim was sharing a bedroom on the day of the incident.
Correction Narrative: On 8/4/2025, the operation's Director provided the following corrections via email: The resident was relocated to a private bedroom on the same day this issue was confirmed. Effective immediately, the Administrator must review all Preliminary Service Plans before finalizing room assignments during intake. The Case Manager will now verify bedroom requirements for each resident to ensure continued compliance with service plan directives.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was given the wrong medication and there is no evidence to show a health care professional was contacted.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was given the wrong medication and there is no documentation of the medication error.
Correction Narrative: This standard was evaluated and found to be in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: Two staff record reviewed indicated staff did not receive and/or meet the exemption of pre-service experience training.
Correction Narrative: All staff must complete all onboarding training before being placed in ratio. Also, staff being hired must have at least 40 hours of experience in an RTC setting that provides the same services.

Deficiency Narrative: Background check fee was delinquent as of inspection date. It was due on or before 12/31/24.
Correction Narrative:
The administrator confirmed that the background check fee was paid on 12/21/24. This information was also verified online.
Corrective action plan stating that going forward, the invoice will be paid online on a monthly basis

Deficiency Narrative: Scheduled II psychotropic medications were observed in an unlocked cabinet during the visit.
One staff record reviewed indicated staff did not have a cleared TB screening prior to having contact with children in care.
Correction Narrative: All new employees will be required to have their TB test completed prior to starting the shadowing and training processes.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff record reviewed indicated that thestaff member did not complet the required 8 hours of EBI training before being included in the ratio.
Correction Narrative: Moving forward, all staff will be trained in Emergency Behavioral Intervention prior to being placed in ratio.

Deficiency Narrative: One of four child medication records reviewed was missing documentation for a medication that was given to a child for one day/date.
Correction Narrative:
A corrective action plan was sent to rccr on 05/03/2024 stating the following:
The corrective action plan for the medication error is as follows:
1. Staff Training on Medication Documentation
2. Medication Audit to be conducted weekly and turned in to LCCA for monitoring.

Staff Training sign-in sheet was obtained.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff allowed children to violate the operation's rules by allowing the children access into one another's bedroom closet with the closet door closed. It was founded that while the children were located inside the closet the children attempted to use a vape.
Correction Narrative: An inspection was conducted at the operation on 04/23/2024, insp #3998777. In order to meet compliance the operation posted signs stating no room visiting allowed. The alleged staff is no longer employed at the operation. The director stated the staff have been instructed to conduct supervision checks every 10 minutes instead every 15 minutes. The director stated a supervision training is being held with staff on this date, 04/23/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: Three staff records reviewed did not contain accurate/completed pre-employment screenings. (2 were missing the screenings and 1 was not completed correctly)
Correction Narrative: An email was sent to rccr from the operation staff with the required completed pre-employment screenings documents.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation office is being used to store medication for a child in care who was discharged from the operation back around November 1 or 2. The medication was found in an unlocked closet and unlocked office, which provides access and accessibility to the medication, including other children in care.
Correction Narrative: Effective immediately, a lock was installed to the closet door. In addition, BEMAG Pharmacy has been contacted to verify the pickup date for discarded medicine. They confirmed the pickup will be by the end of the month, since is the end of the quarter.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care, Aidan M., on October 3, was referred by Galaxia Dental to see an endodontist for a root canal to be completed on teeth #31 and #18. Per the recommendations, Aidan was to be prepped for the crown on the same teeth once the root canals were completed. No documentation shows that the root canals or crowns have been completed per the dentist's recommendation.
Correction Narrative: An Appointments Follow up Dates sheet has been created to ensure the operation keeps track of current and future Medical, Dental, Vision, Mental, appointments/follow-ups. For the specific case of minor a specialist has been contacted and scheduled a follow up appointment for 2/1/2024.

Deficiency Narrative: The office where active child records are stored was unlocked and provided access for anyone to enter the property and gain access to confidential information.
Correction Narrative: Effective immediately, all active staff have been instructed to keep the main doors (upstairs office and facility door) always locked when leaving the premises of the facility. A check Log has been implemented to record the times when staff check and verify the doors are locked.

Deficiency Narrative: Three employee's personnel files have no documentation showing their completion of the annual training.
Correction Narrative: All employees (active and onboarding) completed suicide prevention training on 11/8/2023. The training certificates were provided.

Deficiency Narrative: The operations vehicle (Chrysler Town and Country) has expired temporary tags and no inspection sticker.
Correction Narrative: Car dealer was contacted to request a current/accurate temporary tag. Current temporary tag has been issued and properly placed on the corresponding vehicle.

Deficiency Narrative: One worker is missing a job description from their personnel file.
Correction Narrative: Missing job description has been added to the employee file. All current employee files have been reviewed to ensure proper documentation is on file.

Deficiency Narrative: The job description in one workers personnel file has the name of an employee that is not employed or listed on the person's list of the operation.
Correction Narrative: Job description with wrong name has been removed from file and the correct one has been added. All active employee files have been inspected to ensure that proper documents are filed and in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: The smoke detector in room 4 is flashing red and beeping.
Eight beds were observed to be missing top sheets, and two beds were missing mattress pads.
The operations vehicle (Chrysler Town and Country) has expired temporary tags and no inspection sticker.
Correction Narrative:
The Dealership has extended the
temporary registration and tags until
the permanent plates are ready for pick
up.

Deficiency Narrative: In bedroom room one, the bottom bunk did not have a mattress protector. A bed skirt was being used as a mattress protector.
The grounds of the operations were observed to have tall grass in the front yard and multiple bags of trash were observed in front of the apartment door.
Correction Narrative:
Boys to Men has purchased additional
garbage cans to supplement for any
trash overages. A follow up inspection was conducted on 9/22/23 to confirm compliance with this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: The deeper freezer in the kitchen does no have a thermometer to verify food is at the appropriate temperature.
Correction Narrative: The back up deep freezer immediately was given a thermometer to verify food is at the appropriate temperature. This was confirmed during a follow up inspection at the operation on 9/22/23.

Deficiency Narrative: Three out of three children records were observed to be missing.
Correction Narrative:
Boys to Men RTC administration
team has placed a checklist in place
to ensure that all residents are
provided the childs rights upon
arrival and must sign a statement
indicating that the child has read and
understands these rights. A copy of a
timely signed CPS Rights of Children
and Youth in Foster Care will meet
this standard. This signed form must
then be put in the childs record.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff made changes to the operations floor plan without providing notification. The second living room is now being utilized as an office space that children in care do not have access to.
Correction Narrative:
Boys to Men will give a 15day notice in
the future of any floor plan adjustments.
Boys to Men has since changed the floor
plan back to the original plan. This was confirmed during a follow up inspection at the operation on 9/22/23.

Deficiency Narrative: Insects were observed in the living quarters of children in care and around the door frame of the backdoor.
Correction Narrative:
Boys to Men has sprayed for all insects,
and has created a buildings and
grounds checklist to ensure the facility
is free of insects daily. This was confirmed during a follow up inspection at the operation on 9/22/23.

Deficiency Narrative: During an inspection at the operation it was discovered that 15 year old biological daughter of an owner of the operation resides at the operation without an initial background check being submitted.
Correction Narrative: I conducted a walkthrough of the operation. The 15-year-old biological daughter of the executive director was not observed on the operation grounds and the apartment/office on the property has been vacated by operation staff that was living in the property.

Deficiency Narrative: Two dogs were observed on the property; however, the animal's vaccination records were not available for review.
Correction Narrative:
Documentation for rabies vaccination
for the service animals was provided.

Deficiency Narrative: Employee record is missing the TB test, job description, and the performance evaluation.
Correction Narrative: The operation provided updated TB screening for employee and is therefore now compliant with this standard.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was determined that the operation's vehicle did not start properly and did not appear ready to transport children.
Correction Narrative: The operation purchased an alternate vehicle and satisfied all automobile requirements according to minimum standards. Compliance has now been met.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation does not have a full-tine administrator.
Correction Narrative: The operation hired a suitable administrator, thus compliance is now met.

Deficiency Narrative: The policies submitted should follow the guidelines of minimum standards, but it should also be tailored to your operational needs/wants.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their policies and procedures and revised all necessary portions according to minimum standards; thus compliance is now met.

Deficiency Narrative: The assessment did not have a space for trauma, immediate goals, determination of how the operation will meet the needs, maladaptive behavior, birth/neonatal history, or criminal history. Also, did not see a spot for the services that will be provided to child.
Correction Narrative: The operation thoroughly updated their admission assessment and included all missing information. Compliance is now met.

Deficiency Narrative: The plan did not include the immediate treatment and care needs, as well as a designation of who will be responsible for the child.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their preliminary service plan and revised all necessary portions according to minimum standards; thus compliance is now met.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was observed that the operation's vehicle did not have a required inspection or proper vehicle registration.
Correction Narrative: The operation purchased an alternate vehicle and satisfied all automobile requirements according to minimum standards. Compliance has now been met.

Deficiency Narrative: The form was missing a spot for reporting to Licensing. The form was also missing a spot for gender and DOA.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their annual summary log and revised all necessary portions according to minimum standards; thus compliance is now met.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation's policies include an address unrelated to this operation. The operation's policies state the children will attend a school district that is not in the area of the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their address and advised that the children in care will attend school at a school district in the area of the operation.

Deficiency Narrative: During the inspection, it was determined that the serious incident report did not include the address and phone number of the operation.
Correction Narrative: The operation updated their serious incident documentation forms and revised all necessary portions according to minimum standards; thus compliance is now met.
